page.title: 11ARTS/CRAFTS IN NETHERBURY
page.content: Spinning: Ladies meet occasionally for spinning afternoons and practise at home, although only one lives inside the Domesday block. Yarn is then knitted and there are several weavers in the surrounding area. Pottery: Classes are held at Beaminster School and small potteries either sell the product on site or on stalls in the nearby market town. Painting: Classes are available and various media is used at home. 2 or 3 people are at the start of professional careers as artists. Ladies home crafts: Patchwork, needle point, braiding, ragrugs, knitting, smocking, crochet and dressmaking are much in evidence and promoted by the W.I. Woodworking: Practised at Parnham House with its famous workshop.
